{"step_by_step_thinking": "To exclude a disease, we need a test that can accurately identify those who do not have the disease. This means we need a test that gives a negative result when the disease is not present. According to the documents, a test with high specificity is useful for ruling in disease because it rarely gives positive results in healthy patients. On the other hand, a test with high sensitivity is useful for ruling out disease because it rarely gives negative results in patients with the disease. Therefore, to exclude a disease, we need a test with high sensitivity.", "answer_choice": "D. Sensitivity"}
